main event: Multiple unidentified flying objects were observed in the Cincinnati, Ohio area on April 9, 1960 and April 23, 1960.
interesting points: The objects were described as bright, thin, and flying slowly before disappearing behind cloud cover.
The witness reported seeing a red light in the sky that stayed stationary for several minutes before disappearing and reappearing.
The objects were estimated to be around 900 feet high and maneuvered quickly, climbing and disappearing at high speed.
The witness provided hand-drawn sketches depicting the shape and movement of the objects.
The objects were described as brilliant metallic silver and cigar-shaped, appearing larger than other objects observed.
sighted object: multiple bright, thin flying objects and a stationary red light
